page.title: 16Two Haunted Farms.
page.content: {Cullyhall farm,Rydedown Lane. The farm house,2 barns,the wall and gate are Grade II listed buildings.A Georgian front has been put on a much older house. The main door is 9 ft high so that a man on horseback can ride through it as the house used to be a hunting lodge.John Seend used to live at Cullyhall;his father in law was John Seymour,nephew of Queen Jane wife of Henry VIII. Elizabeth 1 might have visited.Now on the 105acres,beef and cereal are grown by the Nesbits. Sally on the Barn at Court Farm. A farm has been here for centuries. In 1839 a statue of the goddess of corn was fixed to the barn,known as Sally. There are lots of stories about her. Most involve her father and being locked in the barn.She dies and now haunts the barn,which now is used for breeding horses!By Fiona,Karen & Sarah
